title: Distress
verses: Psalm 18:6 (WEB) — "In my distress I called on Yahweh, and cried to my God. He heard my voice out of his temple. My cry before him came into his ears."
Psalm 46:1 (WEB) — "God is our refuge and strength, a very present help in trouble."
Psalm 118:5 (WEB) — "Out of my distress, I called on Yah. Yah answered me with freedom."
2 Corinthians 4:8-9 (WEB) — "We are pressed on every side, yet not crushed; perplexed, yet not to despair; pursued, yet not forsaken; struck down, yet not destroyed;"
Psalm 34:17 (WEB) — "The righteous cry, and Yahweh hears, and delivers them out of all their troubles."
body: Your distress is heard in heaven. Refuge is not escape but the strong presence of God with you. In Christ you may be pressed, but you are not crushed; help is present and deliverance is certain in His time.
prayer: Strong Deliverer, hear my cry. Be my refuge and my strength; lift me when I am pressed and bring me out into the freedom of Your salvation. Amen.
